result.execSummary:
The defendant Micheal Allen Keister was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample & $250 DNA surcharge unless already provided.  Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent.  No contact w/Spring Green Pharmacy.  Not to possess controlled substances w/o valid prescription and must notify agent w/in 48 hours if one is received.  Not to go to taverns/bars or business where primary purpose of business is sale of alcohol or drug paraphernalia.  Absolute Sobriety.  Random UA's as requested by agent.

If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Court states cases (13CF64 and 14CF95).  Linda A. Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Micheal Allen Keister in court with Attorney Debra V. O'Rourke.  Defendant Micheal Allen Keister in custody.  Hoffman addresses Court; provides status and recommendation.  Court addresses O'Rourke and Keister; recommendation fro sentencing in both cases and revocation report.  O'Rourke and Keiseter respond; report has been received and reviewed, agree with recommendations.   

Court proceeds with plea/sentencing in 14CF95; Information has been received and reading is waived.  No contest plea entered to Count 1, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court finds Defendant guilty.  Court imposes sentence.
Count 1:
WI State Prison for  6 1/2 years (2 1/2 years Initial Confinement/4 years Extended Supervision) consecutive to 13CF64 
DNA surcharge $250/sample, unless previously ordered
Undergo any counseling per agent.
AODA & treatment
Random Urinalysis as requested by Agent
Absolute sobriety from alcohol and controlled substances unless with a valid prescription
No entering establishments that serve or sell alcohol or drug paraphernalia
Maintain full time employment and/or attend school
No contact with the Spring Green Pharmacy
$268.00 costs & Supervision Fees
Eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program 
Eligible for Earned Release
Count 2:  Dismissed but read in
Count 3:  Dismissed but read in
Count 4:  Dismissed but read in

13CF64:  Court imposes sentence.
Count 1:
WI State Prison for  2 1/2 years (1 year Initial Confinement/18 months Extended Supervision) 151 days credit
Same conditions as 14CF95

Defendant Micheal Allen Keister in court with attorney Debra V O'Rourke.  Defendant Micheal Allen Keister in custody.  Sue M Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE waives preliminary hearing free, voluntarily & knowning. Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 3.  Set for arraignment.  Arraignment scheduled for May 12, 2014 at 09:30 am.

Pre-trial conference on April 11, 2014 at 11:15 am.
Return date on April 22, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Micheal Allen Keister appeared by video means with Attorney ORourke. Prosecuting Atty Sue M. Mueller appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant does qualify and Attorney ORourke gives updated address.  State request $500.00 cash bond w/ conditions.  No warrant history.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney.   Time limits waived. $500.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  May not possess controlled substances w/out a valid Rx.  May not go upon premises of pharmacy in Spring Green, WI.  May not leave the State of Wisconsin.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 11, 2014 at 11:15 am.  Return date scheduled for April 22, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
